title: Font Bureau, Inc. is proud to release Escrow
content:
February 22, 2006. Boston.  
Font Bureau, Inc. is proud to release Escrow,  
a new display family by Cyrus Highsmith:

ESCROW  
When color appeared on the front page of The Wall Street Journal  
in 2002, it was also newly dressed in Escrow. Highsmith's scotch  
roman was heralded as the "spectacular singular element that  
holds the whole [redesign] together" by Design Director Joe Dizney.  
Available in five weights and three widths, with accompanying  
text styles. 44 styles total.

[http://www.fontbureau.com/escrow](http://web.archive.org/web/20140709232522/http:/www.fontbureau.com/escrow "http://www.fontbureau.com/escrow")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140709232522im_/http:/typophile.com/files/escrow.gif)

================ 1000+ FONTS! ======================

There are now more than 1000 styles available for download  
at [http://www.fontbureau.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20140709232522/http:/www.fontbureau.com/ "http://www.fontbureau.com"). This is a momentous occasion and  
we thank all of our talented designers for adding to our Retail  
library over the last 17 years. Recent heavy-hitters like the  
following catapulted us into four digits.

Escrow (44 styles) by Cyrus Highsmith, as seen in The Wall Street Journal  
 [http://www.fontbureau.com/escrow](http://web.archive.org/web/20140709232522/http:/www.fontbureau.com/escrow "http://www.fontbureau.com/escrow")

FB Titling Gothic (49 styles) by David Berlow, as seen in GQ.  
 [http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/titlinggothicfb](http://web.archive.org/web/20140709232522/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/titlinggothicfb "http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/titlinggothicfb")

-and-

Clicker (45 styles) by Greg Thompson, as seen in CSI.  
 [http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/clicker](http://web.archive.org/web/20140709232522/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/clicker "http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/clicker")

=====================================================

ABOUT FONT BUREAU, Inc.  
Font Bureau was founded in 1989 by noted publications  
designer and consultant Roger Black and type designer  
David Berlow to serve the emerging needs of microcomputer-based  
magazine and newspaper publishers seeking unique typographic  
identities. The New York Times, Newsweek and Smart were among  
the first clients to commission type designs. During the past  
16 years, Font Bureau has designed over 1000 fonts for over  
300 publications. A few of these designs remain the exclusive  
property of the publications but most have become part of  
Font Bureau's retail library. The company is based in Boston.
